Package com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.common

Class UnityClientBehaviour

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.demilich.metastone.game.behaviour.AbstractBehaviour
      • net.demilich.metastone.game.behaviour.UtilityBehaviour
        • com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.common.UnityClientBehaviour
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActionListener, Client, GameEventListener, HasElapsableTurns, io.vertx.core.Closeable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Behaviour
    public class UnityClientBehaviour
extends UtilityBehaviour
implements Client, io.vertx.core.Closeable, HasElapsableTurns
    Represents a behaviour that converts requests from ActionListener and game event updates from EventListener into messages on a ReadStream and WriteStream, decoding the read buffers as ClientToServerMessage and encoding the sent buffers with ServerToClientMessage.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • onMulliganReceived

        @Suspendable
public void onMulliganReceived​(java.lang.String messageId,
                               java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> discardedCardIndices)
        Handles a mulligan from a Unity client.

        The starting hand is also sent in the Zones.SET_ASIDE_ZONE, where the index in the set aside zone corresponds to the index that should be sent to discard.

        Parameters:
        messageId -
        discardedCardIndices - A list of indices in the list of starter cards that should be discarded.

        Sends a mulligan request to a Unity client.

        The Zones.SET_ASIDE_ZONE will contain the cards that can be mulliganned.

      • lastEvent

        public void lastEvent()
        Description copied from interface: Client
        Called when the last event in a stack of GameEvent has been evaluated. Typically, a client should be notified of an entire sequence of events, so that it has valid data at the end of each event, rather than as the events are processed.
        Specified by:
        lastEvent in interface Client
